intro: Matelea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered matelea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its clustered, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Matelea parvifolia typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
